medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced epigastric pain for 2 days that then localized to the left lower quadrant (LLQ). He had nausea and multiple episodes of bilious emesis. He initially thought he might have a kidney stone and took medications for relief, but these did not resolve his symptoms. An episode of rigors prompted him to come to the emergency department for evaluation.
medical_history.family_history: One grandparent with colon cancer diagnosed late in life, no family history of inflammatory bowel disease.
